type: “You shall not covet your neighbor’s house. You shall not covet your neighbor’s wife, or his male or female servant, his ox or donkey, or anything that belongs to your neighbor.” Exodus 20:17
created_at:
Let’s pray:
God, guide us to be in peace with what we have, and do not want to possess what it’s not your will for me to possess.
company:
By Wilson Morán
Traslated by Luis Luna Jr
title: The neighbor's grass looks greener
description:
Naboth had a vineyard, Ahab who had lots of land and vineyards, when he saw the vineyard of Naboth he liked it, to the extent that he wanted to buy it, he did everything possible to acquire it, but unable to obtain it he became sad and ill. That caused Jezebel the wife of Ahab to kill Naboth so that Ahab could have the vineyard. 

The story of Ahab and Naboth is a clear example of greed, how it works and the effects it has on the lives of people who suffer from it and those around it. The root of greed is not being satisfied with the things we have and we begin to want the things of others, as the saying goes: 'the neighbor’s grass looks greener.'

Be careful, you may admire what others have but wanting to take away or possess what God has given them becomes greed, this is sin and brings consequences in your life.
